text:
Hey guys it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

As some of you may know, national donut day
is coming up soon, June 6th.
I’m super excited, I love donuts!

And, I’ve been getting so many requests
from you guys to do something Lord of the Rings

related. So if you can’t tell by my Middle
Earth map dress, today I mean business,

we are gonna be decorating some geeky donuts,
that are Lord of the Rings themed.
Alright, let’s get started!

The things you will need, will be: Some different
types of donuts, I went to my local

bakery, but you can go to a grocery store,
or whatever is easiest for you.

I have got regular glazed donuts, some custard
filled donuts, and some maple bars.

And then to decorate, I’ve got different
colors of cookie icing, the colors I’m using

are dark brown, red brown, light brown, green
and white.
Now let’s put it all together!

The first donut that I’m gonna be decorating
are the custard filled donuts,

they look like this, they’re round, they’re
flat, and they’re filled with deliciousness!

I’m gonna be decorating the top of the donut
to look like the iconic door of Bilbo Baggins

home in the Shire, Bag End. I put some green
icing in a decorating baggie with a number

2 tip at the end for a little bit more control,
and I’m just gonna pipe a circle

on the top of the donut. After you’ve finished
icing the green circles on top of your donut,

now we are gonna take the 3 different colors
of brown icing right here.

Dark, red, and light, and we’re gonna be
icing little rectangles all the way around
the green circle to look like bricks.

Just finished our bricks and now we are gonna
add some more details, this part is totally

optional, but I like to do it because it will
look just like the little Hobbit door!

So you’re gonna take the green icing, I’ve
added a number 1 tip,

so it will be a smaller line, and now we’re
just gonna draw vertical lines down the circle,
to look like the wood on the door.

And then we are gonna take our red brown frosting
because it’s the closest to brass

that I have, and I put a number 1 at the end,
and we are gonna do a little boop!

A little circle in the middle of the door
to be the door knocker!

Now we are gonna take our regular glazed donuts
and I'm gonna decorate them to look like

the one ring. I’m really excited, all you
need is white cookie icing, and I put a number

1 tip at the end, and we are gonna do our
best to write elvish all the way around the donut.

And if you mess up, it’s OK, because most
people don’t read elvish!

I won’t tell, Cookie won’t tell, by the
way, if you’ve been hearing snoring, it is

because Cookie has been sleeping, right down
there. She likes to keep me company
when I’m baking, just in case I drop a treat.

The last donut that we are gonna be decorating
are these maple bars!

I chose a donut that was a little bit longer
so that I could fit, oooh! The Evenstar on it!

This is just so cute, I have a little replica necklace,
I lost the chain to it, so I couldn’t

wear it today,  but, I’m gonna set it right
over here. I’m gonna use it as a reference
as I ice the design on top of my donut.

Da-da! Here are the Lord of the Ring Donuts
that we made today!

Thanks you guys for suggesting something Lord
of the Rings.

And remember these are super easy mode to
make, all you need is different colors

of cookie icing, and your favorite donuts,
boom!

And then you can have geeky donuts, for National
Donut Day!

If you guys make these or any other geeky
donuts, please take pictures and send them to me!

I get a big kick out of seeing your baking
creations, it just makes my day!

I’ll be posting pictures of these donuts
on Facebook, Tumblr, Instagram and Twitter!

And if you guys have any other ideas for any
other Nerdy Nummies, please let me know,

leave me a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen!
Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
And happy National Donut Day!
